title: Hepatitis C can be cured. So why aren't more people getting treatment?
description: A new CDC report finds that just a third of those diagnosed with Hepatitis C have cleared the virus — a decade after a cure was made available.

title: The heat is making squirrels 'sploot' — a goofy act that signals something serious
description: As climate change is making extreme heat events more common, these bright-eyed and bushy-tailed critters are "splooting" to cope.

title: Google says it will start blocking Canadian news stories in response to new law
description: The Google fight with the country echoes a similar battle in Australia, where the tech industry eventually struck deals with news publishers after tense negotiations.

title: Gen. Surovikin, Russia's former commander in Ukraine, is detained
description: After mercenary leader Yevgeny Prigozhin's brief mutiny, news emerged that Surovikin knew in advance about the rebellion against Russia's top defense leaders.

title: Why the Supreme Court decision on affirmative action matters
description: Only a small portion of U.S. colleges have selective admissions, where race-conscious admissions can make a difference in who gets in. But the impacts of banning affirmative action are far wider.

title: Our own Milky Way is sending out neutrinos, the so-called 'ghost particles'
description: Scientists have detected these strange particles from outer space before, but this is the first time they've caught cosmic neutrinos from our own Milky Way

title: A big swath of the U.S. is under red and purple air quality alerts from Canada's smoke
description: In Madison, Wis., the air quality was measured at 242 Thursday morning— a "very unhealthy" purple alert rating that many other communities shared, particularly in the Midwest.

title: Read the Supreme Court decision reversing decades of precedent on affirmative action
description: The Supreme Court ruled that race-conscious admissions are unconstitutional in a pair of cases involving Harvard University and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Read the full opinion.

title: 16 people are hospitalized after an Amtrak train crashes into a water truck
description: The Coast Starlight train was carrying 186 passengers when it rammed into a public works tanker truck on a raised gravel crossing. The truck's driver was taken to a trauma center.

title: The Supreme Court rules against USPS in Sunday work case
description: The court ruled in favor of an evangelical Christian Postal Service carrier who refused to work on Sundays for religious reasons.

title: Supreme Court guts affirmative action, effectively ending race-conscious admissions
description: The decision reverses decades of precedent upheld over the years by narrow court majorities that included Republican-appointed justices.

title: Up First briefing: smoke and heat waves; French protests; gravitational waves
description: Canadian wildfire smoke and heat make for unhealthy U.S. air. Protests erupt in France after police kill a teen boy during a traffic stop. A new physics discovery could help us understand black holes.

title: Juan Wauters wants to connect with you, no matter what
description: The Uruguayan-American musician reflects on identity, autonomy and how the pandemic changed his artistic process.

title: AI-generated text is hard to spot. It could play a big role in the 2024 campaign
description: Recent research shows how generative AI could make effective and cost efficient propaganda. It's difficult to detect AI-generated text, raising concerns about the 2024 election.

title: Is gun violence an epidemic in the U.S.? Experts and history say it is
description: Deaths and injuries from guns in the U.S. have increased for years, mirroring the 1990s - the last time gun violence was considered an epidemic.

title: Fatal police shooting of teenager triggers protests and arrests across France
description: The killing of a 17-year-old boy, captured on video, shocked the country and stirred up long-simmering tensions between young people and police in disadvantaged neighborhoods around France.

title: A Yankees pitcher throws a perfect game Wednesday, just the 24th in MLB history
description: New York Yankees pitcher Domingo Germán threw a perfect game Wednesday, just the fourth in team history and 24th overall in Major League Baseball history.

title: Presumed human remains and more Titan debris have been recovered, Coast Guard says
description: The news came hours after the announcement that debris from the Titan, collected from the seafloor more than 12,000 feet below the surface of the North Atlantic, had arrived in Newfoundland.

title: In the Philippines, a survey shows growing support for gays and lesbians
description: The survey, conducted by the nonprofit social research group Social Weather Stations, shows a rise in supportive views of gays and lesbians in the socially conservative country in the past decade.

title: Scientists have found signs of a new kind of gravitational wave. It's really big
description: Scientists say they've found evidence of a very long gravitational wave that could open a window onto supermassive black holes — and perhaps even other extreme, unseen objects in the universe.
